Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Crass \Crass\ (kr?s), a. [L. crassus thick, fat, gross, prob. orig., closely woven. See {Grease} animal fat, and cf. {Crate}, {Hurdle}.] Gross; thick; dense; coarse; not elaborated or refined. ``Crass and fumid exhalations.'' --Sir. T. Browne. ``Crass ignorance'' --Cudworth. [1913 Webster]
crass adj : (of persons) so unrefined as to be lacking in discrimination and sensibility
